thread.title: All-NCC softball teams announced

author: Tyler Dahlgren
title: All-NCC softball teams announced
text:
Arlington's Sabrina Luttig was named honorary captain of the All-NCC first team. All-NCC softball teams announced Tyler DAhlgren 
Arlington's Sabrina Luttig was named honorary captain of the All-NCC first team. 
The Nebraska Capitol Conference announced its annual all-conference softball teams, and they had a heavy Washington County presence to them. 
Arlington senior catcher Sabrina Luttig wrapped up her career by earning honorary captain honors on the first-team. Luttig batted an astronomical .551 with an on-base percentage of .617 while pounding out 43 hits and 34 RBIs. Sophomore Alexa Brenn joined Luttig on the first-team. Brenn finished with 19 wins on the mound for the Eagles. 
Junior Brook Hoesing was selected to the All-NCC second-team after batting .412 with an OBP of .467. Hoesing finished the season with 33 hits and 16 RBI and held down third base for the Eagles. 
On the honorable mention squad, Arlington was represented by sophomore May Hoesing (.366 batting average) and junior Hannah Thompson, who batted .325 and drove in 29 runs. 
Fort Calhoun freshman Courtney Baxter made a splash in her first season as a Pioneer, earning first-team All-NCC honors while helping her team to a 14-11 record. A vacuum at shortstop, Baxter batted .453 this fall and drove in a team-high 33 runs. 
A pair of left-handed hitting Pioneers made their way on to the second team in sophomore Hannah Warner and junior Lauren Nelson. Warner racked up 51 hits and finished the year with a .500 batting average. Nelson had 47 hits and batted .522. 
Earning honorable mention All-NCC honors for the Pioneers was freshman Julie Klemm, sophomore pitcher Kloey Appel, and senior Erin Schulz. Ã—
